feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:23AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk Valleys... Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in the northwest Interior since Monday, with the heaviest amounts in the upper Kobuk and Upper Noatak Valleys. Expect rivers in the Noatak and Kobuk Valleys to see significant rises through the weekend. Flooding is not expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:23AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia Monday night and moving over the Northern Bering Sea and Southern Chukchi Sea Tuesday will bring south winds of 25 to 35 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday and Wednesday. This will cause elevated surf from the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 28 at 8:13AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA ON MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 28 at 11:19AM CDT until August 29 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High waves and dangerous currents are expected as waves build to 3 to 5 feet. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 12:41PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Gusty winds up to 55 MPH possible across portions of Carbon and Albany counties through 5PM. This includes Interstate 80 between Laramie and the Carbon/Sweetwater County line. Use caution if traveling with light and high profile vehicles.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 28 at 4:20AM MDT until August 28 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON FOR MUCH OF SOUTHEAST WYOMING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 419, 420, 421, 422, 423, 425, 427, 430, 431, 432, 433, 436, AND 437...
